author: SlovenianBrick101
title: Volcano Jackhammer 30350: Small, but great set
review:
Box/Instructions

Alright.This is the review of the LEGO City 2016 promotional polybag for the Volcano Explorers.This is the set 30350 Volcano Jackhammer.This set is polybag so you just get the pcs and a litttle instruction booklet. :)

Parts

For the pcs you get the new face print,new torsoue print and a new drill pcs.All other pcs are the same.

Minifigures

In the set you get one minifig.It is the Volcano Explorer.He has the new face and torsoue prints.

The build

The build is not hard at all.I was building the set for about 2 minutes.

The completed model

Well the set is done.Let's start with the vehicle.It is nice and small, but compact.It has got a small turntable with the small plate on it.You have the nice little drill.And it is realy nice build on the side with some pcs for lava and rocks and one crystal pcs.

Overall opinion

Overall it is really nice little set I will put it i my LEGO City.That is it for this review.Stay tooned for more reviews from SlovenianBrick101 :)

author: Speed_champions_fan
title: Surprisingly good
review:
I got this set along with the sports car in a promotion at Smyth's for free. I must admit that when I first saw images of this set I was rather disappointed. It just seemed to be a rejected £5/€6/$7 set. However, having actually built it, it turns out to be quite good.

There is one minifigure, as is common in modern polybags. The figure is very generic and appears in a few other volcano sets. His face has a ginger goatee and some burn marks, which makes sense considering where he works. The torso is superbly detailed front and rear, with a belt, a safety harness, and an orange top underneath. There is some skin visible at the top; that could be dangerous where he works! The legs are printed with some pockets and could be useful elsewhere. Lastly? he has some fire breathing apparatus and a white hard hat.

The build is, as can be expected of a city polybag, short and simple, however the arm is constructed in an interesting way. There are some nice parts, like the turntable, the bulldozer bit, and the harpoon, which you get two of. The finished model looks surprisingly good. The proportions are quite good, and the yellow arm mimics warning labels. The biggest issue is that it is hard to push along. As all the gripping points are above the turntable, it tends to want to wander, and getting it to go straight is a bit of a nightmare.

Pros

Useful figure

Harpoon!

Great display piece

Fits into a scene perfectly

Cons

hard to push

All in this is a great polybag. I would say that if you get a chance to get this set, grab it. You won't regret that decision.
